intro: Pedicularis dolichostachya, commonly known as the long-stalked lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its upright stems and clusters of small, spurred flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and cool climates. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
